content.text: New Retailer On-boarding
If it’s the first time you’re raising a Service Request to Crunch!, please read carefully the section
Wiki/Service Explanation.
You can integrate new retailers into Crunch! for use with Sell-out Europe 360 with 4 easy to follow steps:
Step 1: Gap analysis
You will first need to review the source file(s) given by the provider and then analyse how this maps to the
Sell-out Universal File Format
UFF
You should already be familiar with the UFF however more details about the requirements can be found within the mapping document. The result of this exercise should be a completed document with
-          source and target field mappings from the raw input to the UFF,
-          definitions of any additional logic for deriving field values
-          as well as additional metadata needed for defining how crunch will handle the file(s).
Please note that once this new retailer flow has been made live,  any future changes with either the source file or any logic contained within the mapping will need to be managed with a
Service Request to modify
the existing flow in place.
Step 2: Service Request creation
You will now need to create and submit Service Request in the ServiceNow portal.
Click
here
to open a brand new instance of the service request form for retailer onboarding. You’ll see a page like this in your browser.
Alternatively, you can open the New Retailer request form by going through the MyServices portal:
https://loreal.service-now.com/myservices
Select : Software & Business Applications -> BI & Analytics - > Sell Out New Retailer onboarding.
This will redirect to MyService portal to create new Request for on boarding a new retailer.
Complete the form being sure to fill all the mandatory fields. The form itself also provides lots of useful information for each field. Here is an example of a complete Service request form:
My
Services-Example.pdf
Attach mandatorily the mapping document you created in step 1 being sure to that column F of the document contains the information pertinent to your retailer file.

Attach all other useful documents that can help such as technical documents that explain setting up the connection type (e.g. SFTP details, API documentation), as well as examples of the raw input files.

Once you submit the form, the request will first go to the Sell-out Europe Data Product Owner (DPO) for review (this is to ensure that there is not duplication of work for particular retailers/divisions).

Following DPO approval, The service request will be assigned to the Crunch team to start their analysis. It’s very like they will get in touch with the ‘Business Single Point of Contact’ defined in the form to acknowledge the request as well as discuss the finer points of the mapping in more detail.
Step 3: Build
The team will then start the development work needed to configure Crunch for the new retailer flow.
Step 4: UAT

Once the configuration of the new flow has been completed, the crunch team will run some internal unit tests to ensure the data transformation process works correctly. If this is successful, the team will notify the Business Single Point of contact that the new flow is ready for UAT in the Crunch! QA environment. The Business Single Point of contact will then need to run their tests on the new flow. Upon successful confirmation of the UAT, the new flow will finally be ready to be moved to Production.
